review: After Netflix increased their prices and I cancelled my subscription I didn't think I would get back into watching streaming videos. Back when I had Netflix the streaming was always interrupted and loaded slowly despite my fast internet connection. With Amazon's streaming video service included with Prime, I don't have those annoying lag times that used to discourage me from watching. This new Fire TV is the perfect way to watch all kinds of streaming content on your TV, from the Amazon Prime video collection and apps like YouTube and PBS. I haven't needed to subscribe to Netflix again as I find Amazon's offerings sufficient to keep me entertained. As far as the unit itself, the contstruction and build quality are impressive. I like the minimalist design that isn't garishly cheap looking like some of the other units (Roku). The design fits in with my entertainment system, and the processor is quite adequate with a much better layout and faster navigation than on my PS3. The voice command remote works great and is a convenient smaller size. I am highly satisfied with my Fire TV, and I highly recommend this unit to anybody who enjoys Amazon's Prime movie offerings.

review: The fire stick works as advertised. Set up was easy, and it was very easy to use.HOWEVER ...When you connect to a network, it must be a open network, or a WPA accessible network. You cannot access it via a web based login, such as you would see at hotels.It worked fine on my home network, but when I came to a resort and plugged it into TV, it works fine except that it could not connect to the resorts network, as it has a web based login, not a WPA based login.So, it is a functionally useless device for most hotels, as it cannot support a web-based login.
